security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown instructions. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no environment variables, no external commands. The skill provides code review guidance following industry best practices.

content.user_title: Review code for quality and security
content.value_statement: Developers spend hours reviewing code manually. This skill provides systematic, comprehensive code review guidance covering security, performance, and best practices. Get actionable feedback on your code with specific improvements.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes code for readability, naming, and complexity issues
Reviews code against security best practices and vulnerabilities
Checks for performance issues including algorithmic complexity
Evaluates error handling, logging, and testing coverage
Provides specific code suggestions with example fixes
limitations: Does not execute or test code directly
Cannot access external APIs or documentation
Does not modify source files automatically
Review depth depends on code context provided

use_cases.title: Pre-commit code review
use_cases.description: Review code before committing to catch issues early and maintain code quality standards.

use_cases.title: Security vulnerability scan
use_cases.description: Identify security issues like SQL injection, XSS, and authentication flaws in code.

use_cases.title: PR quality gate
use_cases.description: Enforce coding standards and best practices across team pull requests consistently.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Code Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Please review this code snippet for quality issues: [PASTE CODE]

prompt_templates.title: Security Focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for security vulnerabilities focusing on input validation, SQL injection, and XSS: [PASTE CODE]

prompt_templates.title: Performance Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this code for performance issues including algorithmic complexity, memory usage, and N+1 queries: [PASTE CODE]

prompt_templates.title: Full Code Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a complete code review covering: code quality, security, performance, testing, and documentation. Focus on critical issues first: [PASTE CODE]

output_examples.input:
Review this Python code for security issues:

cursor.execute(f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = {user_id}")
output: Problem: User input is concatenated directly into SQL query
Risk: Attackers can manipulate the query to access unauthorized data
Fix: Use parameterized queries with placeholders
Example: cursor.execute("SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ?", (user_id,))

best_practices: Provide complete code context including imports and function signatures for accurate analysis
Specify the programming language explicitly when requesting reviews
Focus on one concern at a time (security, performance, style) for detailed feedback
anti_patterns: Reviewing single lines without surrounding code context
Skipping error handling and edge cases in your review request
Ignoring security concerns when asked for quick feedback only

faq.question: Which programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with any language including Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, Go, Rust, C++, and others.

faq.question: How detailed is the code analysis?
faq.answer: Analysis depth depends on the code context provided. Include imports, dependencies, and related functions.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Use within Claude, Codex, or Claude Code. Integration depends on your existing AI tool configuration.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill runs entirely within your AI tool. No code is sent to external services.

faq.question: Why are my issues marked low severity?
faq.answer: Low severity issues are style preferences or minor improvements. Critical and major issues require immediate attention.

faq.question: How does this compare to linters and formatters?
faq.answer: Linters check syntax and style rules. This skill provides deeper analysis including architecture, security patterns, and design decisions.
